JUDGES: André Potocki;Angelika Nußberger;Ann Power-Forde;Dean Spielmann;Elisabet Fura;Ganna Yudkivska
TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . She is represented before the ORG by Mr D. Medvedskiy , a lawyer practising in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent Mr PERSON , succeeded by PERSON .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE the applicant , who was working at the time as an international train manager , was detained on suspicion of attempted crossborder smuggling of goods , following a conspiracy by a group . She remained in detention , on the basis of judicial decisions , until she was convicted , on DATE , by ORG . By this verdict the court found the applicant guilty as charged and sentenced her to DATE imprisonment , suspended for DATE , and placed her on probation . She was released at the conclusion of the hearing .

The applicant is suffering from a number of kidney , stomach and spinal problems and has a long history of various gynaecological health problems . Thus , since DATE , when she had her left ovary , right fallopian tube and a benign breast tumour removed , she has been being monitored by ORG обласний протипухлинний центр , hereafter “ the Cancer Treatment Centre ” ) .

On DATE the applicant ( who had been in detention since CARDINAL DATE , see above ) was examined at FAC . The doctor recommended that she undergo additional examination and , if necessary , treatment in their centre .
On DATE , CARDINAL DATE , the applicant was taken to ORG no . CARDINAL Hospital ( “ the ORG ” ) , where she underwent inpatient treatment for pyelonephritis ( inflammatory kidney disease ) for DATE .
On DATE , after her discharge from ORG , the applicant was taken back to ORG , where she underwent another medical examination .

From CARDINAL to DATE the applicant was hospitalised in ORG ( Донецьке обласне клінічне територіальне медичне ORG , hereafter referred to as “ FAC ” ) for treatment in respect of a number of chronic kidney , gastric and gynaecological conditions . She was examined by doctors including a neuropathologist , a gastroenterologist , a gynaecologist , and an endocrinologist , was prescribed the necessary treatment , and its implementation was monitored . When the applicant was discharged from the hospital it was recommended that she have a further examination by a kidney specialist in about CARDINAL months’ time .

An X - ray on DATE identified a suspicious shadow on the applicant ’s lung . On DATE a tuberculotherapist diagnosed her with pneumonia and tuberculosis and prescribed non - specific antibacterial therapy for DATE , to be followed by an X - ray examination and another consultation .

On DATE the administration of ORG ( “ the GPE ” ) informed the applicant ’s representative in reply to his inquiry that having regard to its limited resources it was not able to provide the applicant with medical treatment in full compliance with the ORG recommendations .

From DATE to DATE the applicant underwent inpatient treatment for tuberculosis in the GPE medical unit , which consisted of several courses of antibacterial therapy . According to the information submitted by the Government ( not commented on by the applicant ) , she was also examined by tuberculotherapists , including from ORG , on DATE and DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE and DATE , as well as on DATE and DATE . Furthermore , on DATE , DATE and DATE , as well as on DATE and DATE , the applicant underwent X - ray examinations . According to the Government , the applicant then recovered from tuberculosis . They referred in this connection to the conclusion of ORG of DATE , according to which the applicant ’s radiograph of DATE showed post - tuberculosis residual changes in her lungs . Subsequent medical monitoring was recommended in that regard . The applicant however stated that she was still suffering from tuberculosis .

Meanwhile , on CARDINAL , DATE and DATE the applicant was again examined by ORG specialists , who diagnosed nodal mastopathy and ovarian cyst and recommended anti - inflammatory therapy , additional examination and surgery at their centre .

From DATE until her release on DATE the applicant underwent inpatient treatment in the GPE medical unit for gastric ulcer , gastroesophageal reflux disease , osteochondrosis and residual encephalopathy .
According to information from ORG , issued on DATE at the request of ORG , the applicant had no contact with ORG after DATE .
From DATE to CARDINAL DATE she was hospitalised in ORG and ORG for urolithiasis of the left kidney .
On DATE the applicant underwent ovarian surgery in ORG of ORG no . CARDINAL , from which she was discharged on DATE “ in a satisfactory state of health ” .
